sections.title: Introduction / Scenario Setup
sections.summary: Speaker introduces a real scenario: evaluating an existing DB initializer implementation in a products backend project using Entity Framework.
key_actions: Describe current DB initializer implementation
Note uncertainty about best approach with Entity Framework

sections.title: Enable GitHub Copilot Agent and Microsoft Docs Access
sections.summary: The speaker enables GitHub Copilot agent mode and grants it access to Microsoft Docs in order to ask the agent if the DB initializer is implemented correctly for EF Core 9.
key_actions: Enable Copilot agent mode
Grant access to Microsoft Docs
Formulate question about DB initializer for EF Core 9

sections.title: Request Documentation Search and Answer Constraints
sections.summary: Speaker requests that the agent search Microsoft Docs and produce an answer based on the full document content.
key_actions: Ask agent to search Microsoft Docs for EF Core 9 guidance
Request answer based on complete document content

sections.title: Tool Permission Prompt
sections.summary: A permissions dialog appears for the tool; speaker explains risk and chooses to allow permissions for the current session.
key_actions: Review tool permission prompt
Choose permission scope (always allow or only this time)
Allow tool access for this session

sections.title: Agent Analysis and Recommendation Returned
sections.summary: After processing, the agent reports that the existing initializer works but recommends a different approach aligning with Entity Framework Core 9; provides links and references.
key_actions: Wait for agent processing
Review agent recommendations and reference links

sections.title: Request Agent to Implement Changes and Model Selection
sections.summary: The speaker asks the agent to implement the suggested changes, triggering a new agent session. They mention sessions are tied to a model and note available models (GPT-4/5). Agent begins reading project classes to modify code.
key_actions: Trigger new agent session to apply changes
Select model/session (e.g., GPT-4, GPT-5)
Agent reads project files (Program, Context, classes)
ui_elements: Model selection (session tied to a model)

sections.title: Agent Applies Changes and Migration Guidance
sections.summary: Agent finishes implementing changes to align with EF Core 9 recommendations. It highlights that when using migrations you should call MigrateAsync instead of EnsureCreatedAsync and other adjustments.
key_actions: Review modified classes
Switch from EnsureCreatedAsync to MigrateAsync when using migrations
Validate alignment with EF Core 9 recommendations
ui_elements: Modified code files (DB initializer, context, Program)

sections.title: Review and Final Notes
sections.summary: Speaker summarizes that the agent-implemented changes follow documentation, explains conditional logic for sync vs async behavior, and notes the workflow of prompting the agent or manually editing.
key_actions: Review final implementation details
Decide between manual edits or agent-driven changes
Consider additional refinements based on documentation
ui_elements: Conditional logic in code (sync vs async branches)

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot agent mode to consult Microsoft Docs
Granting tool permissions and security considerations
Entity Framework Core 9 recommended DB initialization patterns
